summary: Diff adds per-set target weights via a new `setWeights` array on exercises across backend types and multiple frontend components/utilities. However, it also introduces a migration module outside `backend/main.mo` and changes workout logging to per-set actual weights, which conflicts with stated constraints and non-goals. Evidence for updating backend canister methods (`createWorkout`, `getWorkoutsForClient`) is not visible in the provided truncated diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a separate backend migration module and wired it into the canister, despite the constraint to keep all logic in `backend/main.mo` and keep the backend as a single-actor Motoko canister without additional backend modules.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest constraints: "keep all logic in backend/main.mo"; diff adds `backend/migration.mo` and imports/uses it from `backend/main.mo`.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed the workout logging model to collect per-set actual weights (`actualSetWeights`) rather than keeping a single `actualWeight` input per exercise.
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goal explicitly says: "Do not change the workout logging model to collect per-set actual weights; keep the current single actualWeight input per exercise." Diff changes `ExerciseLog` to include `actualSetWeights` and frontend builds arrays of per-set weights when saving.
